info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 05 at 6:54PM CDT until May 05 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN SMITH...SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHWESTERN WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 653 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Riverton, or 36 miles northeast of Phillipsburg, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported quarter size hail in Riverton. Larger hail is likely occurring south of Riverton. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Red Cloud, Riverton and Inavale. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
